intro: Meliosma nanarum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved meliosma, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It is often found in shaded, moist environments within tropical forests. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems, though it is not widely cultivated.
